column1: Art Institute of Chicago////The museum itself has multiple wings and floors
column2: so it's best to pre-plan or spend 5 minutes consulting the issued map once you are there.  I like the fact that the main staircase to the upper floor takes you directly to one of their most iconic paintings
column6: you still need to venture to the next gallery back to see  the even more popular Sunday on La Grande Jatte.  They use the first one as a warm-up for the second.  There are
column8: a lot of other impressionist works in these and the adjoining galleries.
